name: Wagstaff prime
rephrased: A Wagstaff prime is a prime number that can be expressed as (2 raised to an odd prime exponent plus one) divided by three.
explained: A Wagstaff prime is a prime number of the form (2^p + 1)/3, where p is an odd prime. These primes were named after Samuel S. Wagstaff Jr., with the term coined by Fran√ßois Morain.
related_conjectures: Primality proving under the generalized Riemann hypothesis
Infinitude of primes of specific forms
